pli-tv-bu-vb-np19:2.64: The commentarial explanation makes it clear that what is meant here is that one exchanges money into money. The same is true for the next two cases. See [](Sp.3.696.30): “For one who is exchanging a relinquishable object with a relinquishable object, in accordance with the cases spoken of in the previous training rule,” _purimasikkhāpade vuttavatthūsu nissaggiyavatthunā nissaggiyavatthuṃ cetāpentassa_.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np19:2.67: The commentarial explanation makes it clear that what is meant here is that one exchanges what is not money into money, that is, one is selling something and therefore ending up with money. The same is true for the next two cases. See [](Sp.3.697.7): “One exchanges one’s own non-money for someone else’s money,” _attano vā hi arūpiyena parassa rūpiyaṃ cetāpeyya_.
